title: Provides health insurance coverage to dependent children up to 25 years of age
summary: Defines "dependent children" as including any dependents up to the age of 25.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K

                                         1969

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. JEFFRIES -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to health insurance bene-
         fits for dependent children

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph 4 of subsection (a) of section 3216 of the insur-
    2  ance law, as amended by section 65-d of part A of chapter 58 of the laws
    3  of 2007, subparagraph (C) as added by chapter 240 of the laws  of  2009,
    4  is amended to read as follows:
    5    (4) "Dependent  children"  [(A)]  shall  include any [children under a
    6  specified age which shall not exceed age nineteen] DEPENDENT CHILD UP TO
    7  AT LEAST TWENTY-FIVE YEARS OF AGE WHO IS NOT OTHERWISE COVERED  UNDER  A
    8  POLICY  OF  ACCIDENT  AND  HEALTH  INSURANCE  OFFERED THROUGH HIS OR HER
    9  EMPLOYER except[:
   10    (i) Any] ANY unmarried dependent child,  regardless  of  age,  who  is
   11  incapable  of  self-sustaining  employment  by reason of mental illness,
   12  developmental disability, or mental retardation as defined in the mental
   13  hygiene law, or physical handicap and who became so incapable  prior  to
   14  the  age at which dependent coverage would otherwise terminate, shall be
   15  included in coverage subject to any pre-existing  conditions  limitation
   16  applicable to other dependents.
   17    [(ii)  Any  unmarried student at an accredited institution of learning
   18  may be considered a dependent child until attaining age twenty-three.
   19    (B) may include, at the option of the  insurer,  any  unmarried  child
   20  until attaining age twenty-five.
   21    (C)] In addition to the requirements of [subparagraphs (A) and (B) of]
   22  this  paragraph, every insurer issuing a policy pursuant to this section
   23  that provides coverage for dependent children must make  available  and,
   24  if requested by the policyholder, extend coverage under the policy to an
   25  unmarried  child  through  age  twenty-nine, without regard to financial

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

       A. 1969                             2

    1  dependence who is not insured by  or  eligible  for  coverage  under  an
    2  employer  sponsored  health benefit plan covering them as an employee or
    3  member, whether insured or self-insured, and who lives, works or resides
    4  in  New  York  state  or  the service area of the insurer. Such coverage
    5  shall be made available at the inception of all new policies and at  the
    6  first  anniversary date of a policy following the effective date of this
    7  subparagraph. Written notice of the availability of such coverage  shall
    8  be  delivered  to the policyholder thirty days prior to the inception of
    9  such group policy and thirty days prior to the  first  anniversary  date
   10  following the effective date of this subparagraph.
   11    S 2. Subparagraph (A) of paragraph 1 of subsection (d) of section 4304
   12  of  the insurance law, as amended by chapter 240 of the laws of 2009, is
   13  amended to read as follows:
   14    (A) No contract issued pursuant to this  section  shall  entitle  more
   15  than  one person to benefits except that a contract issued and marked as
   16  a "family contract" [may] SHALL provide that benefits will be  furnished
   17  to  a  husband  and  wife, or husband, wife and their dependent child or
   18  children, or any child or children [not over nineteen] UP  TO  AT  LEAST
   19  TWENTY-FIVE  years  of  age,  [provided  that an unmarried student at an
   20  accredited institution of learning may be considered a  dependent  until
   21  he  becomes twenty-three years of age, provided that the coverage of any
   22  such "family contract" may include, at the option of  the  insurer,  any
   23  unmarried  child  until attaining age twenty-five,] WHO IS NOT OTHERWISE
   24  COVERED UNDER A POLICY OF ACCIDENT AND HEALTH INSURANCE OFFERED  THROUGH
   25  HIS  OR  HER  EMPLOYER  and  provided also that the coverage of any such
   26  "family contract" shall include any other unmarried child, regardless of
   27  age, who is incapable of self-sustaining employment by reason of  mental
   28  illness, developmental disability, mental retardation, as defined in the
   29  mental  hygiene  law,  or  physical handicap and who became so incapable
   30  prior to attainment of the age at which dependent coverage would  other-
   31  wise terminate, so that such child may be considered a dependent.
   32    S 3. Subparagraph (A) of paragraph 1 of subsection (c) of section 4305
   33  of  the insurance law, as amended by chapter 240 of the laws of 2009, is
   34  amended to read as follows:
   35    (A) Any such contract may provide that benefits will be furnished to a
   36  member of a covered group, for himself, his spouse, his child  or  chil-
   37  dren,  or other persons chiefly dependent upon him for support and main-
   38  tenance; provided that a contract under which coverage of a dependent of
   39  a member terminates at a specified age, WHICH SHALL  NOT  BE  LESS  THAN
   40  TWENTY-FIVE  YEARS FOR A DEPENDENT CHILD WHO IS NOT OTHERWISE COVERED BY
   41  A POLICY OF ACCIDENT AND HEALTH INSURANCE OFFERED BY HIS OR HER  EMPLOY-
   42  ER,  shall, with respect to an unmarried child who is incapable of self-
   43  sustaining employment by reason of mental illness,  developmental  disa-
   44  bility,  mental  retardation,  as  defined in the mental hygiene law, or
   45  physical handicap and who became so incapable prior to attainment of the
   46  age at which dependent coverage would otherwise  terminate  and  who  is
   47  chiefly  dependent  upon such member for support and maintenance, not so
   48  terminate while the contract remains in force and the dependent  remains
   49  in  such  condition,  if  the  member has within thirty-one days of such
   50  dependent's attainment of the termination age submitted  proof  of  such
   51  dependent's incapacity as described herein.
   52    S  4.  This act shall take effect immediately and shall apply to poli-
   53  cies issued, renewed, modified or amended on and after such date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to health insurance benefits for dependent children
